artist: Alexander Girard; Herman Miller, Inc., Zeeland, Michigan, Est. 1923
creditline: Gift of Della Petrick Rothermel in memory of John Petrick Rothermel
medium: Cast aluminum, cloth upholstery in "Checker" pattern
text: Alexander Girard was a multitalented architect and designer whose vibrant textiles and folk-art inspired interiors were akin to those of his friends, the designers Charles and Ray Eames. In 1965, he was commissioned by Braniff Airlines to help create a lively and contemporary visual identity for the airline, as they proclaimed "the end of the plain plane". This he did with the creation of numerous fabrics--including the signature "Checker"--each produced in several different color schemes, that were used for aircraft seating, wall panels, and Girard-designed lounge furniture.
title: Sofa from a suite designed for Braniff Airlines, one of a pair
